answers.answer: Hi,BCG uses a live-attenuated strain, and hence there is a concern indeed for a subsequent granulomatous infection, among them prostatitis. Such complications in treatment for bladder cancer are observed in an estimated range of 10-15%. There are adequate antibiotics to control the infection if it does happen.In general, the risk benefit would favor the use of BCG for bladder cancer. There may be some patients with conditions like severe diabetes which may be associated with more immune suppression, may have a higher risk for the complication, so the final decisions have to be individualized.
